required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiofrquency Ablation Combined With Cytokine-induced Killer Cells for the Patients With Ovarian Carcinoma

lead_sponsor.agency: The First People's Hospital of Changzhou

clinical_study.source: The First People's Hospital of Changzhou

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether combining of radiofrequency ablation (RFA) and cytokine-induced killer cells (CIK) transfusion can prolong survival of patients with ovarian carcinoma.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective is to evaluate whether RFA followed by CIK transfusion can prolong survival of patients with ovarian carcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: Recurrence-free survival (RFS) was defined as the time from the date of RFA to the date of recurrence or the date of the last follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events related to RFA and CIK treatments.

arm_group.description: Autologous cytokine-induced killer cells were transfer via venous one week after RFA Interventions

intervention.description: Radiofrequency ablation is performed percutaneously under CT/US guidance
The patients received autologous cytokine-induced killer cells transfusion one week after RFA treatment.
